verses.verse: If there be a <S%H7379>controversy<s%> between <S%H582>men<s%>, and they <S%H5066>come<s%> unto <S%H4941>judgment<s%>, that the judges may <S%H8199>judge<s%> <S%H6663>them<s%>; then they shall justify the <S%H6662>righteous<s%>, and <S%H7561>condemn<s%> the <S%H7563>wicked<s%>.

And it shall <S%H7563>be<s%>, if the wicked man be <S%H1121>worthy<s%> to be <S%H5221>beaten<s%>, that the <S%H8199>judge<s%> shall cause him to lie <S%H5307>down<s%>, and to be <S%H5221>beaten<s%> before his <S%H6440>face<s%>, <S%H1767>according<s%> to his <S%H7564>fault<s%>, by a certain <S%H4557>number<s%>.

<S%H705>Forty<s%> <S%H5221>stripes<s%> he may give <S%H3254>him<s%>, and not exceed: <S%H3254>lest<s%>, if he should exceed, and <S%H5221>beat<s%> him above these with <S%H7227>many<s%> <S%H4347>stripes<s%>, then your <S%H251>brother<s%> should seem vile unto <S%H7034>you<s%>.
You shall not <S%H2629>muzzle<s%> the <S%H7794>ox<s%> when he treads out the <S%H1778>corn<s%>.

If <S%H251>brothers<s%> <S%H3427>live<s%> <S%H3162>together<s%>, and <S%H259>one<s%> of them <S%H4191>die<s%>, and have no <S%H1121>child<s%>, the <S%H802>wife<s%> of the <S%H4191>dead<s%> shall not marry <S%H2351>outside<s%> unto a <S%H376>stranger<s%>: her <S%H2993>husband<s%>'s brother shall go <S%H935>in<s%> unto <S%H3947>her<s%>, and take her to him to <S%H802>wife<s%>, and perform the duty of an <S%H2992>husband<s%>'s brother unto her.

And it shall <S%H1060>be<s%>, that the firstborn which she <S%H3205>bears<s%> shall <S%H6965>succeed<s%> in the <S%H8034>name<s%> of his <S%H251>brother<s%> which is <S%H4191>dead<s%>, that his <S%H8034>name<s%> be not put <S%H4229>out<s%> of <S%H3478>Israel<s%>.

And if the <S%H376>man<s%> <S%H2654>like<s%> not to <S%H3947>take<s%> his <S%H2994>brother<s%>'s wife, then let his <S%H2994>brother<s%>'s wife go <S%H5927>up<s%> to the <S%H8179>gate<s%> unto the <S%H2205>elders<s%>, and <S%H559>say<s%>, My <S%H2993>husband<s%>'s brother <S%H3985>refuses<s%> to raise <S%H6965>up<s%> unto his <S%H251>brother<s%> a <S%H8034>name<s%> in <S%H3478>Israel<s%>, he <S%H14>will<s%> not perform the duty of my <S%H2992>husband<s%>'s brother.

Then the <S%H2205>elders<s%> of his <S%H5892>city<s%> shall <S%H7121>call<s%> <S%H1696>him<s%>, and speak unto <S%H5975>him<s%>: and if he stand to <S%H559>it<s%>, and say, I <S%H2654>like<s%> not to take <S%H3947>her<s%>;

Then shall his <S%H2994>brother<s%>'s wife <S%H5066>come<s%> unto him in the <S%H5869>presence<s%> of the <S%H2205>elders<s%>, and <S%H2502>loose<s%> his <S%H5275>shoe<s%> from off his <S%H7272>foot<s%>, and <S%H3417>spit<s%> in his <S%H6440>face<s%>, and shall <S%H6030>answer<s%> and <S%H559>say<s%>, So shall it be <S%H6213>done<s%> unto that <S%H376>man<s%> that will not build <S%H1129>up<s%> his <S%H251>brother<s%>'s <S%H1004>house<s%>.
And his <S%H8034>name<s%> shall be <S%H7121>called<s%> in <S%H3478>Israel<s%>, The <S%H1004>house<s%> of him that has his <S%H5275>shoe<s%> <S%H2502>loosed<s%>.

When <S%H582>men<s%> <S%H5327>argue<s%> <S%H3162>together<s%> one with <S%H251>another<s%>, and the <S%H802>wife<s%> of the <S%H259>one<s%> draws <S%H7126>near<s%> for to <S%H5337>deliver<s%> her <S%H376>husband<s%> out of the <S%H3027>hand<s%> of him that <S%H5221>strikes<s%> <S%H7971>him<s%>, and puts forth her <S%H3027>hand<s%>, and <S%H2388>takes<s%> him by the <S%H4016>secrets<s%>:
Then you shall cut <S%H7112>off<s%> her <S%H3709>hand<s%>, your <S%H5869>eye<s%> shall not pity <S%H2347>her<s%>.
You shall not have in your <S%H3599>bag<s%> various <S%H68>weights<s%>, a <S%H1419>great<s%> and a <S%H6996>small<s%>.
You shall not have in your <S%H1004>house<s%> various <S%H374>measures<s%>, a <S%H1419>great<s%> and a <S%H6996>small<s%>.

But you shall have a <S%H8003>perfect<s%> and <S%H6664>just<s%> <S%H68>weight<s%>, a <S%H8003>perfect<s%> and <S%H6664>just<s%> <S%H374>measure<s%> shall you <S%H3117>have<s%>: that your days may be <S%H748>lengthened<s%> in the <S%H127>land<s%> which the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> your <S%H430>God<s%> gives <S%H5414>you<s%>.
For all that <S%H6213>do<s%> such <S%H428>things<s%>, and all that <S%H6213>do<s%> <S%H5766>unrighteously<s%>, are an <S%H8441>abomination<s%> unto the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> your <S%H430>God<s%>.
<S%H2142>Remember<s%> what <S%H6002>Amalek<s%> <S%H6213>did<s%> unto you by the <S%H1870>way<s%>, when you were come <S%H3318>forth<s%> out of <S%H4714>Egypt<s%>;

How he <S%H7136>met<s%> you by the <S%H1870>way<s%>, and struck the <S%H2179>last<s%> of <S%H2826>you<s%>, even all that were feeble <S%H310>behind<s%> <S%H5889>you<s%>, when you were faint and <S%H3023>weary<s%>; and he <S%H3373>feared<s%> not <S%H430>God<s%>.

Therefore it shall <S%H3068>be<s%>, when the Lord your <S%H430>God<s%> has given you <S%H5117>rest<s%> from all your <S%H341>enemies<s%> round <S%H5439>about<s%>, in the <S%H776>land<s%> which the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> your <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H5414>gives<s%> you for an <S%H5159>inheritance<s%> to <S%H3423>possess<s%> <S%H4229>it<s%>, that you shall blot out the <S%H2143>memory<s%> of <S%H6002>Amalek<s%> from under <S%H8064>heaven<s%>; you shall not forget <S%H7911>it<s%>.
